CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Their corresponding UV absorption data are listed in Table 2. In DCM solution , PBDT-TDPP-S shows two obvious absorption peaks. The first one at ∼ 420 nm corresponds to the π-π* transition of the polymeric backbone in short wavelength region. The second one at ∼ 590 nm in long wavelength region is attributed to the ICT interaction between the donor unit in the main chain and the acceptor unit at the side chain. Compared with the absorption spectrum in DCM solution , the one in solid film displayed a red - shift absorption peak at 602 nm and an additional shoulder at 655 nm besides the highenergy peak. The extended absorption edge in long wavelength region can be attributed to the more aggregated configuration formed in solid state. Compared to the main - chain copolymer of PBDTDPP-OR reported by the Jo group , this side - chain copolymer of PBDT-TDPP-S exhibited a 100 nm blue - shifted maximum absorption peak. The observed blue - shifted absorption phenomenon should be related to the less planar conformation and weaker D-A interaction for the side - chain D-A copolymer than the main - chain D-A copolymer. As a result , the optical band gap ( E g opt ) of PBDT-TDPP-S was shifted to 1.73 eV as calculated from the onset of absorption spectra in the solid film. 2.3. Electrochemical Properties. The electrochemical cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) curve of the PBDT-TDPP-S film coated on a platinum electrode is shown in Figure S3 ( see Supporting Information ) , and the electrochemical data are also summarized in Table 2. An onset oxidation potential of 0.94 V and an onset reduction potential of -0.88 V ( vs SCE ) are observed. Based on an empirical formula , the corresponding HOMO and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels ( E HOMO and E LUMO ) of PBDT-TDPP-S were calculated to be -5.34 and -3.52 eV , respectively. This resulting E HOMO level is lower than those of the reported mainchain D-A copolymers of PDPP - BDT ( -5.16 eV ) and PBDTPP-OR ( -5.29 eV ). 8 The relatively low E HOMO for PBDT-TDPP-S is beneficial to achieve high V OC in PSCs , given the strong correlation between the V OC and the difference between the E HOMO of donor and the E LUMO of acceptor in PSCs. 8 2.4. Photovoltaic Properties. The photovoltaic properties of the PBDT-TDPP-S were studied in PSCs using PC61BM or PC71BM as an acceptor. The device configuration was ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 30 nm ) / polymer : acceptor ( 80 nm ) / LiF(0.7 nm ) / Al(100 nm ). The effective device area was 7 × 10^-2 cm^2 , as defined by a shadow mask.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PBDTDPP-OR |
| PDPP-BDT |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |
| ITO |
| PEDOT |
| PSS |
| LiF |
| Al |

Note:

* PBDT-TDPP-S, PBDTDPP-OR, and PDPP-BDT are all polymers.
* PC61BM and PC71BM are acceptors.
* ITO, PEDOT, and PSS are materials used in the device configuration.
* LiF and Al are materials used in the device configuration, specifically in the electrode.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PBDT-TDPP-S |
| PBDTDPP-OR |
| PDPP-BDT |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

Note:

* PBDT-TDPP-S, PBDTDPP-OR, and PDPP-BDT are all polymers.
* PC61BM and PC71BM are acceptors.

The first one at ∼ 420 nm corresponds to the π-π* transition of the polymeric backbone in short wavelength region. The second one at ∼ 590 nm in long wavelength region is attributed to the ICT interaction between the donor unit in the main chain and the acceptor unit at the side chain. The extended absorption edge in long wavelength region can be attributed to the more aggregated configuration formed in solid state. Compared to the main - chain copolymer of PBDTDPP-OR reported by the Jo group , this side - chain copolymer of PBDT-TDPP-S exhibited a 100 nm blue - shifted maximum absorption peak. The observed blue - shifted absorption phenomenon should be related to the less planar conformation and weaker D-A interaction for the side - chain D-A copolymer than the main - chain D-A copolymer. The electrochemical cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) curve of the PBDT-TDPP-S film coated on a platinum electrode is shown in Figure S3 ( see Supporting Information ) , and the electrochemical data are also summarized in Table 2. An onset oxidation potential of 0.94 V and an onset reduction potential of -0.88 V ( vs SCE ) are observed. This resulting E HOMO level is lower than those of the reported mainchain D-A copolymers of PDPP - BDT ( -5.16 eV ) and PBDTPP-OR ( -5.29 eV ). 8 The relatively low E HOMO for PBDT-TDPP-S is beneficial to achieve high V OC in PSCs , given the strong correlation between the V OC and the difference between the E HOMO of donor and the E LUMO of acceptor in PSCs. 8 2.4. Photovoltaic Properties. The photovoltaic properties of the PBDT-TDPP-S were studied in PSCs using PC61BM or PC71BM as an acceptor. The device configuration was ITO / PEDOT : PSS ( 30 nm ) / polymer : acceptor ( 80 nm ) / LiF(0.7 nm ) / Al(100 nm ). The effective device area was 7 × 10^-2 cm^2 , as defined by a shadow mask.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| π-π* transition |
| ICT interaction |
| absorption peak |
| absorption spectrum |
| optical band gap (Eg opt) |
| onset oxidation potential |
| onset reduction potential |
| HOMO energy level (EHOMO) |
| LUMO energy level (ELUMO) |
| VOC |

Note: VOC stands for "open-circuit voltage" and is a property of a photovoltaic device, not a material property.

The observed blue - shifted absorption phenomenon should be related to the less planar conformation and weaker D-A interaction for the side - chain D-A copolymer than the main - chain D-A copolymer. The electrochemical cyclic voltammetry ( CV ) curve of the PBDT-TDPP-S film coated on a platinum electrode is shown in Figure S3 ( see Supporting Information ) , and the electrochemical data are also summarized in Table 2. This resulting E HOMO level is lower than those of the reported mainchain D-A copolymers of PDPP - BDT ( -5.16 eV ) and PBDTPP-OR ( -5.29 eV ). 8 The relatively low E HOMO for PBDT-TDPP-S is beneficial to achieve high V OC in PSCs , given the strong correlation between the V OC and the difference between the E HOMO of donor and the E LUMO of acceptor in PSCs. 8 2.4. Let's think step by step.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |
| 420 nm | π-π* transition of the polymeric backbone in short wavelength region |
| 590 nm | ICT interaction between the donor unit in the main chain and the acceptor unit at the side chain |
| 602 nm | Red-shifted absorption peak in solid film |
| 655 nm | Additional shoulder in absorption spectrum in solid film |
| 1.73 eV | Optical band gap (Eg opt) of PBDT-TDPP-S |
| 0.94 V | Onset oxidation potential (vs SCE) |
| -0.88 V | Onset reduction potential (vs SCE) |
| -5.34 eV | HOMO energy level (EHOMO) of PBDT-TDPP-S |
| -3.52 eV | LUMO energy level (ELUMO) of PBDT-TDPP-S |
| -5.16 eV | EHOMO level of main-chain D-A copolymers of PDPP-BDT |
| -5.29 eV | EHOMO level of main-chain D-A copolymer of PBDTPP-OR |
| 80 nm | Thickness of polymer layer in PSC device |
| 30 nm | Thickness of PEDOT:PSS layer in PSC device |
| 7 × 10^-2 cm^2 | Effective device area |

Note: The values in the "Property Value" column are presented in the same units as in the original paragraph.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value | Description |
| --- | --- |

| 590 nm | ICT interaction between the donor unit in the main chain and the acceptor unit at the side chain |

Note: The entities that were removed were:

* "Onset oxidation potential (vs SCE)" and "Onset reduction potential (vs SCE)" as they do not clearly refer to the value of a material property.
* "EHOMO level of main-chain D-A copolymers of PDPP-BDT" and "EHOMO level of main-chain D-A copolymer of PBDTPP-OR" as they are not directly related to the material property of PBDT-TDPP-S.
* "Thickness of polymer layer in PSC device" and "Thickness of PEDOT:PSS layer in PSC device" as they are not material properties of PBDT-TDPP-S.
* "Effective device area" as it is not a material property of PBDT-TDPP-S.
